intro: [WRONG START] Hieracussion arbenzii, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and bright yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils, such as roadsides and waste areas, and is often considered a weed. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it produces achenes with pappus for wind dispersal. Hieracium arbenzii is known for its rapid growth and ability to colonize open habitats.
